intro: Lopezia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and often succulent leaves. The plant is characterized by its large, fleshy, ovate leaves that are typically gray-green in color. It produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Lopezia macrophylla is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
